sidebar.deleteServiceTip: Deleting a service will delete all APIs under the service, as well as associated favorites, metrics, variables, and other information. Please confirm whether to delete?
sidebar.restartServiceTip: All tasks under the service will be updated to "Pending Test", and related statistics and status will be cleared. Are you sure to restart the test task 「{name}」?
sidebar.reopenServiceTip: All tasks under the service will be updated to "Pending Test", and statistics and status will not be cleared. Are you sure to reopen the test task 「{name}」?
sidebar.funcTestExecSmokeTip: Execute the smoke test case for all APIs under the current service. If the smoke test script for the test service does not exist, the test script will be automatically generated based on the API smoke test case. If it exists, the corresponding test script will be started.
sidebar.funcTestExecSecurityTip: Execute the security test case for all APIs under the current service. If the security test script for the test service does not exist, the test script will be automatically generated based on the API security test case. If it exists, the corresponding test script will be started.
sidebar.funcTestExecTip: Execute the functional test for all APIs under the current service that are enabled for functional testing. If the test script does not exist, the test script will be automatically generated based on the API. If it exists, the corresponding test script will be started.
sidebar.perfTestExecTip: Execute the performance test for all APIs under the current service that are enabled for performance testing. If the test script does not exist, the test script will be automatically generated based on the API. If it exists, the corresponding test script will be started.
sidebar.stabilityTestExecTip: Execute the stability test for all APIs under the current service that are enabled for stability testing. If the test script does not exist, the test script will be automatically generated based on the API. If it exists, the corresponding test script will be started.
sidebar.deleteServiceSuccess: Delete successful, you can view the deleted service in the recycle bin

actions.generateTestScriptTip: Automatically generate functional, performance and stability test scripts for APIs.
actions.deleteTestScriptTip: Delete functional, performance and stability test scripts for APIs.
actions.generateTestTaskTip: Generate functional, performance and stability test tasks.
actions.restartTestTaskTip: Update task to 'Pending' status, related statistics and status will be cleared.
actions.reopenTestTaskTip: Update task status to 'Pending', without clearing statistics and status.
actions.deleteTestTaskTip: Delete functional, performance and stability test tasks for APIs, including test scripts.

batchModifyModal.selectedApisTip: Please select at least one API

messages.serviceNotExist: Service does not exist or you do not have permission to view

authModel.title: Service Permissions
authModel.onTip: After enabling "Permission Control", manual authorization is required to have corresponding operation permissions for the project. The default is to enable "Permission Control". Note: Authorizing a service does not authorize interface permissions under the service. If the authorization object does not have parent project permissions, it will automatically authorize view permissions.
authModel.offTip: After enabling "No Permission Control", all users in the account can view and operate the service and interfaces under the service.

execTest.title: Execute Test
execTest.execSuccess: Execution started successfully, please check the status and test results in the "Execution" section
execTest.serviceConfigDefault: Use Default (Server Configuration When Generating Script)
execTest.serviceConfigModify: Modify Variable Configuration (Updated to Interface and Dynamic Http Extracted Variables)

mock.description: Mock can quickly generate and simulate the dependencies of the API, enabling faster development, more comprehensive testing, and earlier delivery of stable products or applications. Mock can also avoid dirty data problems caused by direct production system debugging.
mock.namePlaceholder: Service identifier naming information, up to 100 characters
mock.serviceDomainUrlPlaceholder: After setting the domain name for the service, the mock interface can be accessed through the domain name
mock.servicePortPlaceholder: The port listened by the service, the service cannot be modified after addition (1~65535)
mock.nodePlaceholder: The node where the service runs, the service cannot be modified after addition

noProxy.title: No Proxy
noProxy.tip: Directly request the interface through the browser, and cancel the cross-domain limit for non-same-origin access to the interface server.

clientProxy.title: Client Proxy
clientProxy.tip: Install "<a href='https://www.xcan.cloud/help' target="_blank" class="text-text-link">Proxy Program<a>" on the computer where the browser is accessed, and the client proxy will be used after configuration.

serverProxy.title: SERVER_PROXY
serverProxy.tip: Install "Proxy Program" separately on the shared network server host, and use the server proxy without installing the proxy program on each user's computer, and the server proxy will be used after configuration. Recommended.

cloudProxy.tip: Request the interface through the AngusTester cloud server node, note: cannot access the customer intranet service address.

agent.connectFailTip: Proxy connection failed, please check if the proxy service is running.
agent.configFailTip: The server proxy is not configured or enabled, please check "Application Management->Proxy Configuration"

case.hints: Currently added {num} cases, each interface supports a maximum of 100 cases.

addModal.title: Generate API Case
addModal.namePlaceholder: Enter case name, up to 400 characters

debugModal.proxyError: Request error (please check request parameters or proxy connection status)
debugModal.wsProxyErr: Request error (please check request parameters or whether the browser triggers the "CORS-Cross-Origin Resource Sharing" limit, if the cross-domain limit is triggered, please use a proxy or configure the interface service to allow cross-domain access)
debugModal.conditionMessageEmpty: Expression is empty, execute the assertion
debugModal.conditionMsgFormat: Expression format error, only support operators 「"=", "!=", ">=", "<=", ">", "<"」
debugModal.conditionMsgFormatFail: Expression format error, cannot extract variable name
debugModal.conditionMsgFormatErr: Expression format error, ignore the assertion
debugModal.conditionMsgDefineFail: The variable is not defined, the value of the variable is processed by the variable name
debugModal.conditionMsgIgnore: The calculation result is not established, ignore the assertion
debugModal.conditionMsgExec: The calculation result is established, execute the assertion
debugModal.urlRule: Interface address is invalid, please re-select
debugModal.descriptionPlaceholder: Enter case description, up to 800 characters

externalDoc.hints: Reference external resources as current interface document extensions

importForm.fileTip: The file can be dragged directly into this area for upload, the file size is not more than 20M, and the supported file types are .zip,.rar,.7z,.gz,.tar,.bz2,.xz,.lzma,.json,.yaml,.yml.
importForm.deleteWhenNotExisted: Whether to delete the current interface when it does not exist in the imported data
importForm.fileRule: Please check if the file is a Postman Collection V2/V2.1 version JSON file!

moveModal.title: Move Interface
moveModal.hints: When moving the interface to the service, the default is not to authorize the interface associated user to view the service permission. If needed, please authorize through the service "permission".
moveModal.selectServiceTitle: Select the service to move to

oas.hints: Components can be used to define reusable object collections. The supported component types include: data model, response, parameter, example, request body, request body, header, and security scheme. Note: when a component is not referenced by an API attribute, it has no effect on the API.

addModal.descriptionPlaceholder: Enter description, up to 2000 characters, support Markdown syntax

errors.proxyNotConnected: Proxy not connected, please check proxy configuration
errors.requestErrorWithProxy: Request error occurred (please check request parameters or proxy connection status)
errors.requestErrorWithCors: Request error occurred (please check request parameters or whether browser 'CORS-Cross-Origin Resource Sharing' restrictions are triggered. If cross-origin restrictions are triggered, please use proxy or configure API service to allow cross-origin access)

notifications.apiPublishedWarning: API is published and cannot be modified

hints.serializationDescription: AngusTester serialization rules are based on a subset of UR templates defined by RFC6570. Supports OAS3 Schema data types including: string, boolean, integer, number, object, array.
hints.serializationDescription_pre: AngusTester serialization rules are based on a subset of UR templates defined by
hints.serializationDescription_later: . Supports OAS3 Schema data types including: string, boolean, integer, number, object, array.

rules.limit: > Only supports primitive types, primitive type arrays, and object types. Other complex type data models are not parsed.

rules.support: > Supports all types, including object and array type nesting.

rules.limit: > Only supports primitive types, primitive type arrays, and object types. Other complex type data models are not parsed.
> Only supports primitive types, primitive type arrays, and object types. Other complex type data models are not parsed.

debugTip.componentSync: Component debug value modification and synchronization: Modifying debug values for Query, Path, Header, and Form type parameters that reference components will synchronize modifications to the component, and other interfaces that reference the component will also be synchronized; while Raw request body content that references components will not synchronize modifications to the component when debug values are modified, meaning Raw request body component debug value modifications will not affect other interfaces.
debugTip.variableSupport: Locations where variables are supported in interfaces: Security schemes (Authorization), Path parameters, Query parameters, Header parameters, request body Form parameters, request body Raw, assertion condition expressions, and assertion expected values.
debugTip.functionSupport: Locations where functions are supported in interfaces: Path parameters, Query parameters, Header parameters, request body Form parameters, and request body Raw.

buttonGroup.generateTestScriptTip: Generate interface functional, performance and stability test scripts.
buttonGroup.deleteTestScriptTip: Delete interface functional, performance and stability test scripts.
buttonGroup.setTestTip: Generate functional, performance and stability test tasks.
buttonGroup.reTestTip: Update the task to "Pending" and the related statistics and status will be cleared.
buttonGroup.reopenTip: Update the task to "Pending" and the statistics and status will not be cleared.
buttonGroup.deleteTaskTip: Delete interface corresponding functional, performance and stability test tasks, including test scripts.

hints.main: Tags serve as additional metadata for APIs to group them. An API can have multiple tags, meaning it belongs to multiple groups. The order of tag definitions will be consistent with the order of APIs grouped by tags and the order of interface display in documentation.
hints.sub: Each tag name must be unique; not all interfaces need to be associated with tags; maximum 2000 tags can be added.

messages.dataNotSaved: Data not saved, please save data or cancel editing first

useCases.title: Use Cases
items: Provide support for multilingual API documentation

notes.title: Notes
items: AngusTester will use DeepSeek for translation by default
Translation is processed asynchronously, you will receive a notification message when completed
Translation process may take from a few minutes to several hours, depending on API scale
After translation is completed, you can view it in "APIs → Services"

messages.proxyNotConnected: Proxy not connected, please check proxy configuration

mockApi.description: Mock APIs can quickly generate and simulate the APIs you depend on, enabling parallel development and testing, thereby accelerating development speed, achieving more comprehensive testing, and delivering stable products or applications earlier. You can create corresponding mock interfaces for the current interface through two methods: "Generate Mock API" or "Associate Mock API". Mock interfaces will provide simulated data for convenient interface debugging and testing.

generate.title: Generate Mock API
generate.description: Create a new mock version based on the current interface. After creation, you can use the Mock API for data simulation and status testing, thereby achieving more efficient interface debugging.

associate.title: Associate Mock API
associate.description: Associate the current interface with an existing Mock service interface. After association, data simulation and status testing can be performed during interface debugging.

modal.summaryPlaceholder: Please enter the corresponding Mock API name, if not specified, the current interface name will be used by default
modal.generateHint: Generate Mock API based on the current interface.
modal.associateHint: Associate with existing interfaces under Mock service.

tips.fileSizeLimit: Interface debugging supports up to 100MB files, files within 10MB can be saved, exceeding this limit will not be saved.

form.valuePlaceholder: Please enter debug value, maximum {maxLength} characters supported
form.enumPlaceholder: Please enter enum values, multiple values separated by commas

messages.variableNameInvalid: Name does not meet variable requirements, allows numbers, letters, !@$%^&*()_-+=./ etc.
messages.debugFileSizeLimit: Total upload file size for request body during debugging cannot exceed 100MB

form.valuePlaceholder: Please enter debug value, maximum {maxLength} characters supported
Please enter debug value, maximum {maxLength} characters supported
Please enter debug value, maximum {maxLength} characters supported

form.serverPlaceholder: Server address, URL prefix for API address

tips.variableNotFound: Variable not found, please define the variable first or refresh and try again

descriptions.paramValidation: When enabled, parameters will be validated first, and requests will only be sent after parameter validation passes. Default is disabled.
descriptions.connectTimeout: Specifies the maximum waiting time for establishing a connection between client and server. 0 means never timeout, default is 6 seconds.
descriptions.readTimeout: Specifies the maximum waiting time for the client to receive server connection closure after establishing a connection. 0 means never timeout, default is 60 seconds.
descriptions.retryNum: Number of retries when request fails. Default is no retry, maximum allowed is 6 times.
descriptions.maxRedirects: Number of redirects when request returns 3xx status code. Default is 1 time, maximum allowed is 10 times.

form.summaryPlaceholder: Please enter API name, within 40 characters
form.operationIdPlaceholder: Please enter operation ID, within 40 characters
form.tagsPlaceholder: Please enter or select tags, press Enter to confirm input
form.descriptionPlaceholder: Limit input to 20000 characters, supports markdown syntax

tips.duplicateApi: Note: APIs under the same service cannot be duplicated, i.e., the combination of request method and API path (excluding query parameters) must be unique.
tips.tagsDescription: Tags are used as additional metadata for API grouping.
tips.externalDocsDescription: Reference external resources as extensions to current API documentation.

form.summaryPlaceholder: Please enter API name, within 40 characters

hints.authDescription: Grant operation permissions for specified "projects, services, interfaces" to users, departments, and groups. When granting permissions, "view" permission is required. Users can only authorize projects/services/interfaces for which they have authorization permissions.

messages.selectApiFirst: Please select an API first to view details

modal.title: API Permission
modal.onTips: After enabling "has permission control", you need to manually authorize service permissions to have corresponding API operation permissions. "Has permission control" is enabled by default. Note: If the authorized object does not have parent service permissions, view permissions will be automatically granted.
modal.offTips: After enabling "no permission control", all users will be allowed to publicly view and operate the current API. Users viewing the API must also have current API parent or service permissions.

hints.selectMockServiceFirst: Please select a Mock service first to generate or associate Mock API.
hints.generateMockApi: Generate Mock API based on current API.
hints.associateMockApi: Associate with existing API under Mock service.

placeholder.inputMockApiName: Please enter corresponding Mock API name, current API name will be used by default if not specified

project.on: After enabling "has permission control", you need to manually authorize project permissions to have corresponding project operation permissions. "Has permission control" is enabled by default. Note: Authorizing projects will not authorize API permissions under the project.
project.off: After enabling "no permission control", all users under the account will be allowed to publicly view and operate projects and APIs under the project.

service.on: After enabling "has permission control", you need to manually authorize service permissions to have corresponding project operation permissions. "Has permission control" is enabled by default. Note: Authorizing projects will not authorize API permissions under the service. If the authorized object does not have parent project permissions, view permissions will be automatically granted.
service.off: After enabling "no permission control", all users under the account will be allowed to publicly view and operate services and APIs under the service.

hints.generateMockService: Generate Mock service based on current service.
hints.associateMockService: Associate current service with existing Mock service.

modal.title: Mock Service Permission
modal.onTips: After enabling permission control, you need to manually authorize to have corresponding operation permissions.
modal.offTips: No permission restrictions, all users in the account can view and operate, permission control is not enabled by default.

form.title: Generate Mock Service
form.namePlaceholder: Service identification naming information, maximum 100 characters allowed
form.domainPlaceholder: After setting a domain for the service, you can access Mock APIs through the domain
form.portPlaceholder: Port that the service listens on, cannot be modified after service is added (1~65535)
form.nodePlaceholder: Node where the service runs, cannot be modified after service is added

description.title: Mock services can quickly generate and simulate APIs you depend on, enabling parallel development and testing, thereby accelerating development speed, achieving more comprehensive testing, and delivering stable products or applications earlier. You can create corresponding simulated interfaces for current service APIs through two methods: "Generate Mock Service" or "Associate Mock Service". These simulated interfaces will provide mock data for API debugging and testing.
description.generateMockService: Create new Mock service based on current service APIs. After creation, you can use these Mock APIs for data simulation and state testing, achieving more efficient API debugging.
description.associateMockService: Associate current service with existing Mock service. After association, the system will automatically generate corresponding Mock APIs in the associated Mock service. These APIs can be used for data simulation and state testing in API debugging.

hints.testEnableDescription: Only after API testing is enabled will testing be marked as a mandatory activity, and test results will be included in the overall analysis. This ensures comprehensive and accurate test coverage. You can enable API testing in the following two ways:
hints.singleApiEnable: 1. Single API Enable: Go to API debug page -> Select "API Metrics" in the right tab bar -> Enable corresponding options for required test types.
hints.batchEnable: 2. Batch Enable: Find the target service in the service list -> Right-click and select "Enable or Disable Testing" -> Batch operate all API tests under the service.

messages.deleteConfirm: Deleting the API will also delete associated follows, favorites, metrics, variables and other information. Please confirm deletion?
messages.deleteSuccess: Deleted successfully, you can view the deleted API in the recycle bin

tips.generateTestScript: Generate functional, performance and stability test scripts for the API.
tips.deleteTestScript: Delete functional, performance and stability test scripts for the API.
tips.generateTestTask: Generate functional, performance and stability test tasks.
tips.restartTestTask: Update task to 'Pending', related statistics and status will be cleared.
tips.reopenTestTask: Update task status to 'Pending', without clearing statistics and status.
tips.deleteTestTask: Delete functional, performance and stability test tasks for the API, including test scripts.

confirm.restartTestTask: Update the API test task to "Pending", related statistics and status will be cleared. Do you confirm to restart the test task 「{summary}」?
confirm.reopenTestTask: Update the API test task to "Pending", without clearing statistics and status. Do you confirm to reopen the test task 「{summary}」?

tips.funcTestExec: Execute current API functional test. If test script doesn't exist, it will automatically generate functional test script based on the API. If it exists, it will start the corresponding functional test script.
tips.perfTestExec: Execute current API performance test. If test script doesn't exist, it will automatically generate performance test script based on the API. If it exists, it will start the corresponding performance test script.
tips.stabilityTestExec: Execute current API stability test. If test script doesn't exist, it will automatically generate stability test script based on the API. If it exists, it will start the corresponding stability test script.

permission.title: API Permission
permission.onTips: After enabling "Permission Control", you need to manually authorize service permissions to have corresponding API operation permissions. Permission control is enabled by default. Note: If the authorized object does not have parent project/service permissions, view permissions will be automatically granted.
permission.offTips: After enabling "No Permission Control", all users will be allowed to publicly view and operate the current API. Users viewing the API must also have parent project or service permissions.

testTask.infoText: Generate corresponding task when API test task doesn't exist. If task already exists, it will override current test information.

options.useDefault: Use Default (Server configuration when generating interface scripts)
options.modifyVariables: Modify Variable Configuration (Modifications will update to interface and dynamic HTTP extraction variables)

welcome.title: Welcome to Angus API!
welcome.description: Here you and your team can complete the following work:
features: Manage projects, services, APIs and test tasks;
Conduct API functional testing, performance testing and stability testing to ensure delivery of stable systems that meet business requirements.

debug.title: Debug API
debug.description: Edit and debug APIs online quickly.

addProject.title: Add Project/Service
addProject.description: Organize APIs through projects or services, projects can contain multiple services (such as microservices) and APIs, services can only contain APIs.

import.title: Import Service from File
import.description: Import OpenAPI or Postman API YAML files or JSON files.

configuration.syncDescription: Automatically import external OpenAPI to current {type}
configuration.securityDescription: Define security schemes (Authorization) that can be used by all APIs under current {type}
configuration.serverDescription: Define servers (Server URL) that can be used by all APIs under current project/service
configuration.performanceDescription: Set default performance metrics for APIs under {type}, performance metrics will affect performance test pass rate; if you want to set performance metrics for a specific API separately, you can set it in API performance configuration
configuration.shareDescription: Through sharing, you can authorize others to view API documentation and debug APIs within a specified time
configuration.variablesDescription: Through defining variables, you can reuse a parameter value or control condition execution

myApis.title: My APIs
myApis.createdEmptyTip: You haven't added any APIs yet,
myApis.deleteTip: Are you sure you want to delete API 「{name}」?

home.introduceContent: Interface design for OpenAPI specifications, meeting the needs of interface testing and documentation generation. The graphical interface is suitable for users unfamiliar with OpenAPI specifications, while users familiar with OpenAPI specifications are recommended to use Swagger Editor for more efficient design completion.
home.title: Added Designs

deleteFirm.title: Are you sure to delete design「{name}」?

importDesignModal.title: Import Design
importDesignModal.namePlaceholder: Enter design name, limited to 100 characters
importDesignModal.uploadTip: Click to upload Swagger2.0, OpenAPI3.x files, file size not exceeding 20M

editModal.versionPlaceholder: OpenAPI document specification version number, default 3.0.1.

mock.startFail: Start Failed, please try to restart
mock.refreshInstance_tip: Refreshing the instance will forcibly synchronize service configuration, interface security, CORS settings and Mock interfaces to the running service instance.

introduce.description: Mock can quickly simulate dependent APIs, enabling parallel development and testing, improving efficiency while avoiding production data pollution.
introduce.addMockServiceDesc: Manually add apis after creating Mock service.
introduce.importServiceDesc: Create Mock based on existing services and apis, system automatically establishes associations.
introduce.importFileDesc: Support Swagger, OpenAPI3.x, Postman2.0/2.1, Angus format file import.

permission.title: Service Permissions
permission.onTips: After enabling permission control, manual authorization is required to have corresponding operation permissions.
permission.offTips: No permission restrictions, all users in the account can view and operate, permission control is not enabled by default.

form.namePlaceholder: Service identifier naming information, up to 100 characters
form.domainPlaceholder: After setting the domain name for the service, the mock interface can be accessed through the domain name
form.domainTooltip: Domain name resolution is expected to take effect within 60 seconds.
form.portPlaceholder: The port listened by the service, the service cannot be modified after adding (1~65535)
form.nodePlaceholder: The node where the service is running, the service cannot be modified after adding

upload.uploadDescription: Directly paste content or drag and drop files or click to upload files, the file size does not exceed 20M
upload.fileSizeExceeded: The file or text size exceeds 20M, please re-upload
upload.postmanVersionError: Please check if the file is a Postman Collection V2/V2.1 version JSON file

basicInfo.title: Basic Information
basicInfo.nameTooltip: Service identifier naming information, up to 100 characters.
basicInfo.domainTooltip: After setting the domain name for the service, the mock interface can be accessed through the domain name, the domain name set needs to be resolved to the IP of the node where it is located.
basicInfo.portTooltip: The port listened by the service, the service cannot be modified after adding.
basicInfo.nodeTooltip: The node where the service is running, the service cannot be modified after adding.
basicInfo.serviceConfigTooltip: The main parameters of the service running, more parameter configuration please refer to the official website related documents. The modification needs to be restarted after the service takes effect.
basicInfo.useSslTooltip: Enable SSL option on Netty Http server, the default is not enabled.
basicInfo.workThreadNumTooltip: The number of threads of the service running, the default is 100.
basicInfo.logLevelTooltip: Configure request log information level, including four options: NONE, BASIC, HEADERS and FULL.

logFileLevel.basic: Only record request method and URL as well as response status code and execution time, the default.
logFileLevel.headers: Record basic information as well as request and response headers.
logFileLevel.full: Record request and response headers, body and metadata.

basicInfo.sendRequestLogTooltip: Whether to send Mock request log to the service side.
basicInfo.maxContentLengthTooltip: The maximum allowed request size, the default is 1000*1024*1024 (1000MB).
basicInfo.pushbackThreadNumTooltip: The number of threads for processing pushback requests, the default is 8.
basicInfo.pushbackConnectTimeoutTooltip: The maximum connection timeout when pushing, in milliseconds, the default is 5000.
basicInfo.pushbackRequestTimeoutTooltip: The maximum request timeout when pushing, in milliseconds, the default is -1 not timeout.
basicInfo.securityHints: The modification needs to be restarted after the service takes effect.
basicInfo.securityTooltip: Used to configure the authorization information required for accessing the interface, after enabling the configuration, the interface must carry the authorization parameter to access the interface. Up to 10 can be added.

apis.hints: When an interface is not yet implemented or inaccessible, Mock interfaces can be used to simulate the behavior and data return of real interfaces for development and testing work, thereby improving development and testing efficiency. Note: Mock interfaces take effect only after being saved.
apis.matchTooltip: Specify the matching request conditions that need to be met to return the current response. Note: When there are multiple responses that meet the matching conditions, the response with the highest priority will be returned. If no matching conditions are configured or the priorities are the same, the first condition or the first configured condition will be returned.
apis.priorityTooltip: The higher the value, the higher the priority. Value range: 0~2147483647. Note: The response with the highest priority will only be returned when there are multiple responses that meet the matching conditions.
apis.pushbackTooltip: Pushback can be used to automatically push an Http request to a specified address after receiving a Mock request, such as: payment callback.

notifications.dataError: Data error, please check and correct before saving.
notifications.proxyNotConnected: Proxy not connected, please check proxy configuration
notifications.yamlFormatError: YAML content format error, please check and correct

confirmations.deleteApi: Are you sure to delete the API 「{summary}」?
confirmations.refreshInstance: Refreshing the instance API will force synchronization of current Mock API information to the running service instance.

delayParameter.title: Delay Parameter
delayParameter.maxLessThanMin: Maximum value is less than minimum value

pushBack.title: Push Back
pushBack.proxyNotConnected: Proxy not connected, please check proxy configuration

match.title: Match
match.pathTooltip:
Path starts with slash /, representing root path.
Path consists of multiple path segments separated by slash /.
Each path segment can be composed of letters, numbers, hyphens, underscores and other characters, and does not contain special characters (such as ?, #, etc.).
Path segments cannot be empty strings.
match.pathPlaceholder: Start with slash /; path segments separated by slash /, no special characters (such as ?, #, etc.)
match.onlyOnePath: Only one path can be added
match.onlyOneRequestBody: Only one request body can be added

agent.title: AI Agent
agent.description: AI Agent can help you quickly generate Mock API response content
agent.notConfigured: Server proxy not configured or enabled, please check 'Application Management -> Proxy Configuration'
agent.connectionFailed: Proxy connection failed, please check if the proxy service is running.

tips.noProxy: Request interfaces directly through the browser. For cross-origin access, the server needs to remove CORS restrictions.
tips.clientProxy: Need to install 'proxy program' on the computer where the browser is located. After configuration, client proxy will be used to send requests.
tips.serverProxy: Need to install 'proxy program' separately on a server host in the shared network. Using server proxy does not require users to install proxy programs on their respective computers. After configuration, server proxy will be used to send requests. Recommended method
tips.cloudProxy: Request interfaces through AngusTester cloud server nodes. Note: Cannot access customer intranet service addresses.

importApiModal.title: Import API
importApiModal.hints: Supports Swagger2.0, OpenAPI3.x, and Angus format interface file imports.
importApiModal.deleteNotExisted: Whether to delete when current interface does not exist in imported data

cors.title: Cross-Origin Setting
cors.description: Resolve browser cross-origin access restrictions and configure cross-origin access policies. Restart service after changes.
cors.enabledTooltip: Enable cross-origin access configuration, disabled by default.
cors.allowCredentialsTooltip: Allow cross-origin requests to carry credentials (like cookies), enabled by default.
cors.allowRequestMethodsTooltip: Allowed HTTP request methods, supports all common methods by default.
cors.allowRequestHeadersTooltip: Allowed request header fields, no restrictions by default.
cors.allowExposeHeadersTooltip: Response header fields accessible to clients, no restrictions by default.

requestRecord.hints: Mock interface call logs, max 3 per second, 100 records per interface. Enable/disable logging in "Settings"->"Send request log". Enabling may affect performance.

tooltips.requestCount: The number of times the mock interface is called.
tooltips.mockExceptionCount: The number of times the mock interface returns an Http status code of 4xx and 5xx response.
tooltips.pushbackCount: The number of times the mock service pushes a request to the user's configured pushback interface.
tooltips.successCount: The number of times the request returns a status code of 2xx.
tooltips.exceptionCount: The number of times the mock interface configuration errors or the program itself causes errors.

settings.logTooltip: Record basic information and request/response headers.
settings.corsTooltip: Resolve browser cross-origin access restrictions and configure cross-origin access policies. Restart service after changes.
settings.enableNettyLogTooltip: Recommended for debug mode only, disabled by default.

detail.serverTip: Server URL already exists, please re-enter
detail.serverVariableTip: Variables in Server URL cannot be repeated
detail.serverConfigTip: Server configuration error, please check and correct before saving.
detail.urlPlaceholder: URL prefix pointing to target host, e.g.: https://{env}.xcan.cloud:{prot}/{path}
detail.variableValueTip1: Values of the same variable cannot be duplicated

introduce.title: About Servers
introduce.description1: Define the servers and server-related dynamic parts of the API, including two parts: server and variables. The server field is used to specify the server list of the API, each server has a URL and optional description information, indicating the base path of the API.
introduce.description2: Variables are used to define dynamic parts in URLs. It allows the use of placeholders in server URLs, which can be replaced with actual values in different environments. The main benefits are as follows:

integration.title: Easy Integration with CICD
integration.description: In continuous integration and continuous deployment workflows, defined servers can help automate testing processes, making API endpoints in different environments flexibly configurable, meeting DevOps requirements.

env.title: Support Multiple Environments
env.description: Support different environments (such as development, testing, production, etc.) by defining multiple servers or through different variable values. This enables developers to easily switch environments without manually changing URLs in code.

version.title: Support Version Control
version.description: In different versions of APIs, different servers or variable values can be defined to manage and maintain versions. Different versions of servers can be clearly distinguished in documentation to avoid confusion.

url.description: Complete URL, server, and endpoint relationship
url.title: Complete URL (path)

form.remarkPlaceholder: Please enter share remark, will be displayed in share information, maximum 400 characters

messages.copySuccess: Share information successfully copied to clipboard

list.title: Added Shares
list.confirmDelete: Are you sure to delete share 「{name}」?

introduce.title: About Sharing
introduce.description: When you need to integrate interfaces with external partners, customers, or other teams, you can use the "Share" feature to pass interface information to them, simplifying the communication process. Sharing includes detailed interface description information, including interface servers, authentication, interface addresses, request formats, and response formats, ensuring everyone has a consistent understanding of the interface.

tips.adminOnly: Only administrators and deleters can restore or permanently delete trash data.

confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this item?
confirm.deleteAll: Are you sure you want to delete all items?

empty.hint: Deleted items will appear here, you can restore or permanently delete them
